lines.value: the city has been known in the past by the successive names wirye seong 위례성 慰禮城 baekje era namgyeong 남경 南京 goryeo era hanseong 한성 漢城 joseon era and hanyang 한양 漢陽
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: its current name originated from the korean word meaning capital city " which is believed to be derived seorabeol 서라벌 ), which originally referred to gyeongju the capital of silla
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: unlike most place names in korea seoul has no corresponding hanja chinese characters used in the korean language
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the recentlychosen chinese name for seoul is 首爾 shouer which sounds somewhat similar to seoul when pronounced in mandarin chinese
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the history of seoul can be traced back as far as 18 bc when it was established as a settlement in baekje
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: itʼs believed that the wiryeseong site is in the boundaries of modern day seoul
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: it has thereafter been the capital of the joseon dynasty
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: in the japanese colonization period in the early 20th century many historical and traditional parts of seoul were changed
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the city was almost entirely destroyed in the korean war but an aggressive economic policy in the 1960s and 1970s helped to rebuild the city very rapidly
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: in the 1990s some important historical buildings were restored including gyeongbokgung one of the royal palaces of the joseon dynasty
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: seoul is in northwest south korea
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: seoul proper comprises 605.39 km² of area roughly bisected into northern and southern halves by the han river
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the han river and its surrounding area played an important role in korean history
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the three kingdoms of korea strove to take control of this land where the river was used as a trade route to china via the yellow sea
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: however the river is no longer actively used for navigation because its estuary is located at the borders of the two koreas barred for entrance by any civilian
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the city is bordered by eight mountains as well as the more level lands of the han river plain and western areas
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: in common with the rest of south korea seoul has a generally humid continental climate despite the fact that the country is surrounded on three sides by water
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: summers are generally hot and humid with monsoons taking place from june until july
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: august the hottest month has an average temperature of 72 °f to 86 °f 22 °c to 30 °c with higher temperatures possible
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: winters are often very cold with an average january temperature of 19 °f to 33 °f -7 °c to 1 °c and are generally much drier than summers although there are 28 days of snow in seoul in each year on average
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the traditional heart of seoul is the old joseon dynasty city which is now the downtown area where most palaces government offices corporate headquarters hotels and traditional markets are located
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: this area occupies the valley of cheonggyecheon a stream that runs from west to east through the valley before emptying into the han river
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: for many years the stream had been covered by concrete but was recently restored through an urban revival project
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: to the north of downtown is bukhan mountain and to the south is the smaller namsan
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: further south are the old suburbs of yongsan gu and mapo gu and the han river
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: across the han river are the newer and wealthier areas of gangnam gu,seocho gu and surrounding neighborhoods
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the world trade center of korea is located in gangnam gu and this is where many expositions and conferences are held
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: also in gangnam gu is the coex mall a large indoor shopping and entertainment complex
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: bamseom is an island in the middle of the han river near yeouido downstream from gangnam gu and is home to the national assembly major broadcasting studios and a number of large office buildings as well as the korea finance building and the world's largest pentecostal church
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the olympic stadium olympic park and lotte world are located in songpa gu on the south side of the han river upstream from gangnam gu
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: south of the sprawling gangnam area are namhan mountain,cheonggye mountain and gwanak mountain
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: major modern landmarks include the korea finance building n seoul tower the world trade center the 63 building and the six skyscraper residence tower palace
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: these and various high rise office buildings like the seoul star tower and jongno tower dominate the city's skyline
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: due to its high density seoul has been equipped with a grand appearance of skyscrapers and the city council is now planning on building a series of high rises including 580-metre business center in sangam digital media city district and an 800-metre lotte world 2 tower in the jamsil pronounced jam-shil district of songpa gu and gangdong gu
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: urban and civil planning was a key concept when seoul was first designed to serve as a capital in the late 14th century
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the royal palaces of the joseon dynasty still remain in seoul with the main palace gyeongbokgung currently being restored to its original form
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: today there are eight major subway lines stretching for more than 250 kilometers with a ninth and tenth line being planned and also some other miscellaneous lines
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the most historically significant street in seoul is jongro meaning bell street " on which one can find bosingak a pavilion containing a large bell
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the bell signaled the different times of the day and therefore controlled the four major gates to the city
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the only time it is normally rung nowadays is at midnight on new year's eve when it is rung thirty three times
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: it was however rung on the day that president kim dae jung took office
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: seoul's most important streetcar line ran along jongno until it was replaced by line 1 of the subway system in the early 1970s
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: other notable streets in downtown seoul include euljiro 을지로 ), teheranno (, tehran street sejongno 세종로 ), chungmuro 충무로 ), yulgongno 율곡로 ), and toegyero 퇴계로 ).
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.name: Uzbek

lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: songpa has the most people while seocho the largest area
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the government of each gu handles many of the functions that are handled by city governments in other jurisdictions
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.name: Uzbek

lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: nearly all of seoul's residents are korean with some small chinese and japanese minorities
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: a rapidly growing population of international residents now represent about 2 % of the total population
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the city's population surpassed 10421000 as of the end of 2007 and the number of foreigners was 229000 constituting 2.2 percent of the population
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the crime rate in seoul is very low and it is considered one of the safest major cities in asia
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the two major religions in seoul are buddhism and christianity
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: other religions include shamanism and confucianism the latter seen more as a pervasive social philosophy rather than a religion
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: as the headquarters for some of the world's largest corporations such as samsung lg and hyundai seoul has become a major business hub in asia
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: although seoul accounts for only 0.6 percent of south korea's land area it generates 21 percent of the country's entire gdp
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: its per capita gdp ranks among the highest among large cities in the region
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: as a major business and financial center seoul ranks fifth in the world in terms of the number of fortune 500 transnational companies headquartered there
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: many international banks have branches in seoul including citigroup hsbc and mizuho financial group
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: one of the largest exchange banks the korea exchange bank is also headquarted in seoul
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the largest market in south korea the dongdaemun market is located in seoul
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: myeongdong is a shopping and entertainment area in downtown seoul which contains some of the city's top stores and fashion boutiques
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: nearby is the namdaemun market named after the namdaemun gate
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: insadong is the cultural art market of seoul where traditional and modern korean artworks such as paintings sculptures and calligraphy are sold

lines.value: itaewon is another notable shopping district in the city lined with boutiques and stores mainly catering to foreign tourists and american soldiers based in the city

lines.value: shinchon is particularly popular with young people perhaps due to its proximity to some of seoul's universities
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the gangnam district is one of the most affluent areas in seoul and has popular modern shopping spots such as the fashionable and upscale apgujeong dong area and the coex mall

lines.value: the city is home to three baseball teams in the kbo the doosan bears the lg twins and woori heroes & two basketball teams in the kbl the seoul samsung thunders and seoul sk knights

lines.value: there is one professional football club in seoul fc seoul which plays in the k league

lines.value: two k3 league teams are based in the capital seoul united and eungpyeong chung goo fc

lines.value: seoul's transportation boom dates back to the era of the korean empire when the first streetcar lines were laid and a railroad linking seoul and incheon was completed
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: seoul was the first city in east asia to have electricity trolley cars water telephone and telegraph systems all at the same time
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: today as a result of the diversification of the city's transportation network it has become a great transportation hub for asia
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: seoul hosts more than three million registered vehicles and widespread traffic congestion is common
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: there are two international airports that serve seoul
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: gimpo international airport formerly in gimpo but annexed to seoul in 1963 was the only international airport for seoul since its original construction during the korean war
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: other domestic airports were built around the time of the war including at yeouido
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: upon opening in march 2001 incheon international airport on yeongjong island in incheon changed the role of gimpo airport significantly
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: incheon is now responsible for almost all international flights and some domestic flights while gimpo serves only domestic flights with the exception of flights to haneda airport in tokyo and hongqiao airport in shanghai
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: this has led to a significant drop in flights from gimpo airport
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: meanwhile incheon international airport has become along with hong kong and singapore a major transportation centre for east asia
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the 2005 aetra passenger survey jointly administered by the iata and airports council international voted it the best airport in the world
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: it was named by skytrax as the world's 5th best airport for 2006
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: incheon and gimpo are linked to seoul by highways and gimpo is also linked by subway line 5
lines.name: Uzbek

lines.value: the incheon international airport railroad a rail line connecting incheon airport to gimpo airport opened in march 2007 but the line to seoul station in central seoul will take at least a year more to open

lines.value: shuttle buses transfer passengers between incheon and gimpo airports
